intro: Psoralea triantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom during the warmer months. The species is noted for its ecological importance, providing nectar for various pollinators.
